javadoc:
A {@link TableFilter} that filters based on column values

This class maintains a list of {@link ColumnConstraintSet} objects that are logically combined to determine if the overall filter accepts the given row object. Each ColumnConstraint has an associated {@link LogicOperation} which determines how its result are combined with the constraint set before it. (The first ConstraintSets LogicOperation is not used). AND operations have higher precedence than the OR operations. @param the row type of the table

methods.javadoc:
Constructs a new empty ColumnBasedTableFilter
@param model the table model
methods.name: <init>
getName
methods.comment:
Returns the name of this filter.

 Names are used for saving filters, so unless they are saved they typically don't have a name.

methods.javadoc:
Sets the name of this filter.
@param name the new name for this filter.
methods.name: setName
methods.comment: Sets the name of this filter.

params.name: name
params.comment: the new name for this filter.

methods.name: addConstraintSet
methods.comment: Adds a new constraintSet to this ColumnBasedTableFilter

params.name: logicalOp
params.comment:
The logic operation (AND or OR) for how the new ConstraintSet's result will be
 combined with the previous ConstraintSet's result.

params.name: columnIndex
params.comment: the model index of the column whose values must past the given constraint filters.

params.name: constraints
params.comment: a list of ColumnConstraints where at least one must pass for the constraintSet to pass.

methods.javadoc:
Return the list of ConstraintSets in this TableFilter
@return the list of ConstraintSets in this TableFilter
methods.name: getConstraintSets
methods.comment: Return the list of ConstraintSets in this TableFilter

return.comment: the list of ConstraintSets in this TableFilter

methods.javadoc:
Serializes this filter into a SaveState object.
@return the SaveState serialized version of this filter.
methods.name: save
methods.comment: Serializes this filter into a SaveState object.

return.comment: the SaveState serialized version of this filter.

methods.name: restore
methods.comment: Restore this filter from the given saveState.

params.name: saveState
params.comment: that contains the serialized filter data

params.name: dataSource
params.comment: the Table's DataSource which some objects might need to restore themselves.

methods.javadoc:
Returns an HTML description of this filter.

Note: the HTML string returned does NOT start with the HTML tag so that it can be combined with other text. @return an HTML description of this filter.
methods.name: getHtmlRepresentation
methods.comment:
Returns an HTML description of this filter.
 
 Note: the HTML string returned does NOT start with the HTML tag so that it can be combined
 with other text.

return.comment: an HTML description of this filter.

methods.name: getToolTip
methods.comment: Return a tooltip  that describes the effect of this filter for a specific filter.

params.name: columnIndex
params.comment: the model index of the column to get a filter description of.

return.comment: a tooltip that describes this filter for a specific column.

methods.name: isEquivalent
methods.comment:
Checks if the given ColumnBasedTableFilter is the same as this one except for
 its name.

params.name: other
params.comment: the other filter to check for equivalence.

return.comment: true if the other filter is the same as this one except for its name

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this filter has been saved (i.e. has a name)
@return true if this filter has been saved (i.e. has a name)
methods.name: isSaved
methods.comment: Returns true if this filter has been saved (i.e. has a name)

return.comment: true if this filter has been saved (i.e. has a name)

name: ColumnBasedTableFilter
comment:
A TableFilter  that filters based on column values

 This class maintains a list of ColumnConstraintSet objects that are logically combined
 to determine if the overall filter accepts the given row object. Each ColumnConstraint has an
 associated LogicOperation which determines how its result are combined with the constraint
 set before it. (The first ConstraintSets LogicOperation is not used).  AND operations have higher
 precedence than the OR operations.
